org.newdawn.slick
Class AngelCodeFont

java.lang.Object
  org.newdawn.slick.AngelCodeFont
All Implemented Interfaces:
Font
public class AngelCodeFont
extends java.lang.Object
implements Font

A font implementation that will parse BMFont format font files. The font files can be output by Hiero, which is included with Slick, and also the AngelCode font tool available at: http://www.angelcode.com/products/bmfont/ This implementation copes with both the font display and kerning information allowing nicer looking paragraphs of text. Note that this utility only supports the text BMFont format definition file.

Author:
kevin, Nathan Sweet

Method Detail

getImage

public Image getImage()
Returns the sprite sheet image that holds all of the images.

Returns:
the image for this bitmap font

setSingleCase

public void setSingleCase(boolean enabled)
If a font has the same glyphs for upper and lower case text, we can minimize its glyph page size by only using one case. If single case is enabled (by default it is disabled), then the getGlyph method (and, in turn, glyph rendering/height/width/etc.) will try to find whichever case exists for the given code point.

Parameters:
enabled - true to enable

isSingleCase

public boolean isSingleCase()
If a font has the same glyphs for upper and lower case text, we can minimize its glyph page size by only using one case. If single case is enabled (by default it is disabled), then the getGlyph method (and, in turn, glyph rendering/height/width/etc.) will try to find whichever case exists for the given code point (between 65-90 for upper case characters and 97-122 for lower case).

Returns:
true if single case is enabled

getDescent

public int getDescent()
Requires export from the newest version of Hiero. Alternatively, you could manually add descent=XX to the end of the 'common' line in your font file. The descent is the distance from the font's baseline to the bottom of most alphanumeric characters with descenders.

getAscent

public int getAscent()
Requires export from the newest version of Hiero. Alternatively, you could manually add ascent=XX to the end of the 'common' line in your font file. The ascent is the distance from the font's baseline to the top of most alphanumeric characters.

getGlyph

public AngelCodeFont.Glyph getGlyph(char c)
Returns the character definition for the given character.

Parameters:
c - the desired character
Returns:
the CharDef with glyph info
